SCENE DESCRIPTION:
On Tuesday, 15 APRIL 1992 at 12: 15AM Det. James Stewart arrived in the
1:00 block of Chartres Street in response to : request for assisterce
in conducting an investigation into a shooting incident that occurred
:* this vocation.
Upon arrival STEWART observed that a portion of the street had been
sealed off with yellow POLICE LINE tape and several officers from the
crime lab were conducting a scene investigation.
Inclusive with these
officers were other officers from the Vieux Carre District assisting
in preserving the scene and maintaining all witnesses.
STEWART noted the lighting conditions were fair and the street was
illuminated with street lights.
This area is residential area with a
museum located at the corner of Ursuline and Chartres Street:
In the
middle of the block on the riverside of the street is a church.
STEWART walked to an area in the sealed off area and observed several
articles of clothing between two cars on the river most side of the
street. Upon closer inspection of these clothes STEWART observed a
small pool of blood. STEWART learned that the clothes were left
behind by Paramedics who had conducted an on scene triage ard
transported the victim to the Louisiana Medical Center.
All necessary measurements and photographs were taken by the Crime lab
for future reconstruction.
STEWART learned from officers that arrived on the scene that the
Victim was a white female laying in the street between two parked
The body was resting on the right side with the head in a
cars.
northerly direction and the feet pointing south. The victim
was in a
fetal position on her right side and her face pointed uptown.
The
victim was suffering from an apparent gunshot wound to the head.
On the riverside of the street is a wall that is runs alongside the
sidewalk for a distance of about twenty feet.
Three parked cars were
noted in the secured area of the crime scene:
On the lakeside of the crime scene is a complex of condominiums and a
museum.
The crime scene was in the 1100 block of Chartres Street between
Governor Nicholls in a downtown direction and Ursuline in an uptown
direction.

BADGE:
Det. James Stewart

On Wednesday, 15 April 1992 at 12:15AM Detective James W. Stewart
assigned to the Homicide Section of the Criminal Investigation Bureau
was assigned to investigate the shooting death of Julie Stott white
female, from ECCLES, England. This assignment was in response to a
radio call from the Criminal Investigation Desk Officer, Fred Moore
whe notified STEWART of a shooting incident in the 1100 block of
Chartres Street.
MOORE informed STEWART that officers assigned to the Vieux Carre
District were investigating a shooting incident that occurred on
Tuesday, 14 APRIL 1992 at about 11: 30PM and requested the assistance
of a Homicide Detective.
This request was made due to the severity of
the injuries incurred by the victim and that these injuries may become
fatal.
The following tract articulates the investigation into the STOTT's
murder and the facts and circumstances surrounding the arrest of five
individuals responsible for the murder of Ms. STOTT.
Prior to arriving at the scene STEWART contacted Det. Michael Fejka
and instructed him to arrive at the Louisiana medical Center and
discern victims condition and extent of all injuries.
STEWART along with the compliment of other homicide detectives
annotated above, arrived on the scene and completed an on scene
investigation.
STEWART documented the crime scene more particularly described in the
SCENE DESCRIPTION SECTION of this treatise.
A canvass of the area was performed by STEWART, Det. Dwight Deal and
Anthony Small. During the canvass of the area;

interviewed JOSEPHINE DESMOND of
She related
that she heard two or three gunshots outside of her residence but
could offer no other information.

Lafayette, Louisiana residing at

stated that she heard two gunshots while inside her condo but thought
they were firecrackers and ignored them. She later realized that
something had happened when the police arrived in front of the
CADY could offer no other information.
complex.
STEWART located Peter Ellis who is the boyfriend of STOTT.
ELLIS was
transported him to the homicide office where a formal statement was
rendered to Detective Melvin Winning: During this statement ELLIS
stated that while he and STOTT were walking in the 1100 block of
Chartres Street they were approached by a lone gunman who ordered them
to lie on the ground.

LESTER stated that ROBERT, BORDERE and HARRIS met in the Desire
housing development earlier in the evening prior to the series of
crimes that were committed on 14 APRIL 1992 and 15 APRIL 1992.
Based upon the interviews conducted with JONES by the investigators,
the evidence collected from JONES, the evidence confiscated from the
apartment at 3223-B desire parkway, the positive match from the gun
confiscated to the bullet removed from the victim, the fact that
LESTER JONES admitted to being present at the crime scene and during
the shooting, and his identification of ROBERT JONES, BORDERE and
HARRIS, the detectives elected to arrest LESTER JONES for the murder
of JULIE STOTT, re-book the other defendants as principals to the
homicide, and booked LESTER JONES with the armed robbery that occurred
at the intersection of Elysian Fields and Saint Claude Avenue
( D-23216-92.)

On 27 APRIL 1992, 2:30PM a Search Warrant that had been obtained for
the 1980 Delta -88- on 23 APRIL 1992 was executed. Crime lab
technician, Tim Seuzeneau performed a detailed search of the vehicle
for any all latent prints, forensic evidence and physical evidence
more particularly described in the RECOVERED VEHICLE SECTION of this
treatise.
SUMMARY:
On 14 APRIL 1992 at about 11:30PM Bethany Acosta and Patrick Hoorebeek
were walking in the 600 block of Governor Nichols Street when they
were approached by Negro male subject who pointed a gun and demanded
their money and valuables.
These two citizens complied with the
perpetrators demands. The perpetrator after receiving these items
occupied a 1980, Maroon, Oldsmobile Delta -88 -, and turned against
traffic on Chartres Street. Once on Chartres Street the vehicle
pulled to the river side of the street at its intersection with
Ursuline Street. Simultaneously, Peter Ellis and Julie Stott were
walking on the same of the street. Once again the assailant exited
the vehicle and attempted to rob the victims.
The victims did not
comply, and the assailant began to shoot at ELLIS and STOTT. During
this shooting Julie Stott was hit twice and died as a result of the
shooting.

At about 1:45AM the same vehicle was used during a robbery at the
intersection of St. Claude Avenue and Elysian Fields Avenue. This
robbery was perpetrated by LESTER JONES of 3223-B Desire Parkway.
JONES was positively identified by the victims.
On 17 APRIL 1992 detectives began to receive information relative to
the perpetrators of the offense.
The informant rendered information
that led to detectives to ROBERT JONES, CHRISTOPHER BORDERE and
PERNELL HARRIS and DONALD OLIVER.
The detectives learned the three
were involved in an argument over the shooting. They were concerned
about the undue pressure this would cause from the police department.
It should be noted that ROBERT JONES admitted to being in the bar room
with the BORDERE and HARRIS. BORDERE denied this, stating, he was
alone. HARRIS also denied being in the bar room.
These statements
seemed to conflict. JONES did corroborate the anonymous tip.
about being in the bar room.
Further into the investigation the detectives were able to recover the
vehicle used in these series of crimes. The driver of the vehicle
LESTER JONES was identified as the perpetrator of the robbery that
occurred after the murder and was found to be in possession of
property stolen prior to the murder from PATRICK HOOREBEEK.
A search of his bedroom at 3223-B Desire Parkway revealed the weapon
used to murder JULIE STOTT, ammunition that was consistent with
the
type used to kill STOTT, and evidence from the robbery after the
murder at Elysian Fields and St. Claude Avenue.
